page.title: 13TEDDINGTON LOCK
page.content: The{River Thames}runs for about 3 miles through Ham and Petersham. The river has atowpath constantly following its bank.The towpath varies in quality and is very liable to flooding.In the main the river runs past picturesque meadows and unspoilt land. On the river's journey through Ham and Petersham it passes{Teddington {Lock.}This lock plays an important part in controlling the river's flow of water.Without the lock the Thames would probably freeze hard enough for skating almost every winter and at low tide in the summer,the river would be reduced to a small trickle.The lock gates are worked by hydraulic power and every time they open 200,000 gallons of water pass through. 175 million gallons of water flow through Teddington Weir each day.
